page.title: 01Guisborough (South)
page.content: Over \ of Guisborough including West- gate,the main street,is in our area,to -gether with some forest, part of the North Yorkshire Moors,and farmland.Not included is the northern half of the town containing the ancient priory,the fire station,compreh.school,etc. Guisb.is an ancient town ment.in Dom. Book.It has today 20,000 people. A 1km belt of coniferous forest run by the For.Commiss. separates the town from the North York.Moors national park to the S. The town is 10 m.from the huge Teesside industrial area. Guisborough itself is a market town and shopping centre with little industry.In the last 20 years it has developed into a dormitory town serving Teesside with large mid.class housing estates to south & west. Few pre-19th buildings remain today.In 1964 the town lost its railway.
